titleStmt.title: [Marriage bond] 1792 Nov. 2, Washington County, between William Perogh and Elizabeth Denton : a machine-readable transcription of an image

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Special Collections Library

availability.p: This work is the property of the Special Collections Library, University of Tennessee, Knoxville, TN. It may be used freely by individuals for research, teaching, and personal use as long as this statement of availability is included in the text.

bibl.title: [Marriage bond] 1792 Nov. 2, Washington County, between William Perogh and Elizabeth Denton
bibl.note: This document is a marriage bond written on November 2, 1792 in regards to marriage of William Perogh and Elizabeth Denton. The bond stipulated an amount of 600 pounds to be void on the condition that there was no lawful objection to the marriage. The bond was signed by John Sevier, and witnessed by Isaac Denton and George Nolen.
Territory of the U.S. South of the River Ohio, Marriage Bond

projectDesc.p: Prepared for The University of Tennessee Digital Library

editorialDecl.p: Quotation marks retained as data except inside q tags
Errors in transcription of the printed text controlled with X-Metal 2.1 spell-checker; text has also been thoroughly proofread
Corrections and normalization represented by editorial tags.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

refsDecl.p: ID attributes provided for only those pages, chapters, or illustrations toward which a reference or figure points.

div.p:
Territory of the United States of American south of the river Ohio,
Washington County.

Know all men by these presents, That we Isaac Denton George Nolen are held and firmly bound unto William Blount, governor, or his successors in office, in the penal sum of Six Hundred Pounds, void condition that there be no lawful objection why William Perogh Elizabeth Denton may not be joined together as man and wife, in the holy estate of matrimony. Witness our hands and seals this
Second day of november 1792
